text: Ōyamatsumi is a Mountain God in Shinto and the father of Ashinazuchi and Tenazuchi.Chamberlain (1882). Section XVIII.—The Eight-Forked Serpent. He is also the father of Konohana Sakuya. His name ends with Mi which is an honorific particle used to express authority or divinity in Old Japanese.本居宣長『古事記伝』七之巻。 ==Family tree== ==References== Category:gods and goddesses of Japan
title: Ōyamatsumi
